content.article_body: LONDON, Aug 19 (APP):A The British-Pakistani lawyers on Tuesday condemned Indian attempt to unilaterally suspend Indus Waters Treaty as a form of awater warfare,a and committed to establishing a UK-based legal task force to defend Pakistanas rights under the treaty and mobilizing international legal and diplomatic support. During his visit to the United Kingdom, Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Senator Mohammad Ishaq Dar addressed the British-Pakistani Lawyers Forum regarding Indiaas unlawful attempt to unilaterally suspend the Indus Waters Treaty a an action that constitutes both a red line and an existential threat to Pakistanas 240 million citizens. In his address, the deputy prime minister emphasized that the 1960 World Bank brokered agreement, which governs 80 percent of Pakistanas freshwater resources and sustains the lives of 240 million people, could not be unilaterally suspended or held in abeyance. He also underscored the treatyas critical importance to Pakistanas water security and ecological stability. This meeting marked the third gathering of the British-Pakistani Lawyers Forum, an initiative launched by the Pakistan High Commission in London, in collaboration with Barrister Amjad Malik.
